data.title: Search Official Records
meta_keywords: pasco county clerk and comptroller official records search
how to search for publid records pasco county
data.meta_description: The Pasco County Official Records system contains Pasco County assignments, deeds, dismissals, judgment, liens, lis pendens, mortgages, orders, plats, satisfactions, and more.
data.text:
Pasco County Official Records

Pasco County Official Records are searchable by name within document types and date ranges. Book and page and instrument numbers also allow direct access to individual documents. The Official Records system contains documents related to property, such as deeds and mortgages. They also contain many court documents, including final judgments.

Indexes are available from 1975 through the current date. Images from 1990 to the present are viewable online by the public except for documents related to probate or family law cases, military discharges, and death certificates.

The images archived are digital reproductions of the original documents presented to the Clerk for recording. Except as specifically directed by law (e.g., redaction of information directed by statute), the Clerk's Office does not alter the content of the original documents during the recording process. Unclear or illegible content in the archived image is likely to be the result of unclear or illegible content in the original document.

Pasco County Historical Records Search

Through Kofile Quicklink we provide free access to Pasco County's Archived Records, including Deeds and Official Records dated 1876-1974.

Protection of Minor Injunction Database

A database with the identity as well as the fact that a final judgment for an injunction for the protection of a minor has been entered against that adult respondent.

Pasco County Plat Maps

Search plat maps online by using the name of the subdivision, plat book, and page number found on the warranty deed, or the section/township/range.

A 24-by-36-inch version of a plat map is available by visiting the Clerk & Comptroller's Office for a fee of $5 per page.

Certified Copies

E-Certify is now available! For your convenience, the Pasco County Clerk of Court & Comptroller is now offering tamper-proof electronic certified document that will include a Clerk of Court digital signature. Additionally, your secure electronic certified document will be available to download immediately after purchase. Please visit the E-Certify page for more information. Documents are available back to 1990, except where exempt. If the case and/or document is not available for viewing on the website, customers can obtain certified records by visiting the Clerkâ€™s Office.

Certified copies may also be purchased over the phone by calling 352-521-4408 or 727-847-8086. We accept Visa, Mastercard, Discover, & American Express. Keep in mind there is a 3.5% fee associated with this transaction.
